report.title: Two day Workshop on HYPERSPECTRAL IMAGE ANALYSIS AND APPLICATIONS

description.text: <p>In recent times Hyperspectral Image Analysis plays vital role in Precision Agriculture, Atmospheric Studies, Mining and other applications. It is of great importance to understand the process of capturing the hyperspectral image and also understand the necessary tools to analyze the data to derive useful knowledge. This Workshop is intended to introduce the basics of Hyperspectral Image Analysis and provide the advances in HSI analysis &amp; applications. Hands-on sessions are also planned for practicing the necessary tools.</p>

report.keywords: Hyperspectral Image Analysis and Applications - Handson Practice Sessions
report.cosponsor_name: IEEE Vizag Bay Subsection and Department of Geo Engineering, AU College of Engineering, Vizag

speaker.organization: Indian Institute of Space Science Technology

topic.title: Recent Advences in Hyperspectral Image Analysis and Applications

description.text: <p>On the 12th of August, National Remote Sensing Day is celebrated every year in honour of Prof. Vikram Sarabhai&rsquo;s birthday, an Indian scientist and innovator, widely regarded as the father of India's space programme. On this occassion planned an event on hyperspectral images analysis and applications. In recent times Hyperspectral Image Analysis plays vital role in Precision Agriculture, Atmospheric Studies, Mining and other applications. It is of great importance to understand the process of capturing the hyperspectral image and also understand the necessary tools to analyze the data to derive useful knowledge. This Workshop is intended to introduce the basics of Hyperspectral Image Analysis and provide the advances in HSI analysis &amp; applications.</p>

topic.title: Expert talk on National Remote Sensing Day

report.title: BlockChain Technology: The Future of Cyber Security from Cyber Attacks

description.text: <p>Cyber security has been a hot-button issue in 2016 and hacking dominated the information security news this year. Cybersecurity is a primary concern to Financial Institutions, Government Sector, policymakers, Industry, Entrepreneurs, and Investors. The&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">blockchain</span>&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">technology</span>&nbsp;will be transformative in the&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">technology</span>&nbsp;and IT sector in the coming years, as this&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">technology</span>innovations have distinct capabilities in mitigating cybersecurity risk to an information&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">technology</span>&nbsp;(&ldquo;IT&rdquo;) system.&nbsp;The relationship between cybersecurity and&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">blockchain</span>&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">technologies</span>&nbsp;<wbr />are deployed in all industries, because blockchains may fit within broader cybersecurity&nbsp;objectives&nbsp;This&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il"><wbr />blockchain</span>&nbsp;<span class="m_-7928566613449740185gmail-il">technology</span>&nbsp;provides enhanced security features, preventing fraud and data theft, increases the resiliency of the overall network, improve the overall robustness and integrity, enhanced transparency, making it much more difficult to corrupt blockchains through malware or manipulative actions, cybersecurity protections on cloud platform&rsquo;s for access controls.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Blockchain expertise is among the top position on the latest skills index in the technology job market.&nbsp; This is just one of the many indicators of how high the demand is for people with blockchain skills. Blockchain may have begun in finance to support cryptocurrencies, but now blockchain technology and the solutions it can provide are being explored by industries from healthcare to insurance to manufacturing and more. The only way companies can explore and achieve goals with blockchain is to hire those who have the skill-set to navigate this new technology.&nbsp;</p>

report.title: Expert Talk on Applications of Geoinformatics to solve groundwater problems in hard rock terrain of the country in 2-3 years

description.text: <p>In recent years, dependency on groundwater has increased exponentially, resulted in significantly lowering of groundwater table in most parts of the country particularly in hard rock terrain. Nonetheless, average annual rainfall over India is about 1120 mm/year (about 4000 km3). It is important to note that very large part of total rainwater (about 90%) is wasted as a surface runoff. It has been estimated that if only 1% of the total rainfall in India is added to present groundwater resources then it would be sufficient to meet the country&rsquo;s domestic requirement of water. The occurrence and movement of groundwater in any terrain is mainly controlled by geology, topography, landuse, soil, geomorphology and structures. Depending on the terrain characteristics, one or several of these parameters contribute to the localization of groundwater. Though there are few surface reservoirs, however insufficient to provide water especially during summer months and groundwater recharge. Further, the groundwater recharge structures e.g.&nbsp; small reservoirs / ponds / Talab which were there in almost each town / village have either encroached or inadequate to recharge prevailing groundwater regimes. Geoinfomatics can assist to offer a solution to find best suitable groundwater recharge sites. Further, time series satellite remote sensing datasets can also provide impact assessment of previous, current and future groundwater recharge structures. Geographic Information Systems (GIS) has modelling capabilities to locate and estimate hydraulic parameters of a potential groundwater recharge structure. How much area would be inundated due to construction of a reservoir / check dam can also be modelled in GIS.&nbsp; Through dam simulation techniques where to construct, what should be the height of such structures may also be analyzed appropriately? Latest remote sensing images can be used to prepare landuse / landcover map to estimate potential submergence of different areas due to potential reservoir sites. Further, which area would deliver better benefit / submerge areas ratio can also be determined by using remote sensing datasets? The proposed talk is going to discuss all the above aspects associated with groundwater recharge particularly in hard rock terrain and how to come out from the current situation in 2-3 years&rsquo; time?</p>

topic.title: Expert Talk on Applications of Geoinformatics to solve groundwater problems in hard rock terrain of the country in 2-3

report.title: John McCarthy Memorial Lecture 2019 : Artificial Intelligence: An Unfinished Revolution

description.text: <p style="font-weight: 400;"><em>Abstract:</em>&nbsp;The current excitement about Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) is at least the third in a cycle of hype followed by disillusionment.&nbsp; In earlier cycles, those methods that had a solid mathematical foundation has survived, while others have faded away.&nbsp; In the current cycle, at least some members of the research community have begun to recognize the need for foundational analysis of currently popular&nbsp;methods such as deep learning.&nbsp; This talk presents an overview of recent successes as well as challenges for the future, to ensure that the current enthusiasm for AI does not lead to disillusionment and despair.</p> <p style="font-weight: 400;"><em>Brief Biographical Sketch:</em>&nbsp;M. Vidyasagar received his Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Wisconsin in 1969.&nbsp; During his fifty-year career, he has received numerous awards in recognition of his research, including&nbsp;<em>Fellowship of The Royal Society</em>, and the&nbsp;<em>IEEE Control Systems Technical Field Award</em>.&nbsp; He is the author of thirteen books and more than 150 papers in refereed journals.&nbsp; At present, he is a&nbsp;<em>SERB Distinguished Fellow</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Distinguished Professo</em>r at IIT Hyderabad.&nbsp;</p>

One-Day Bootcamp on "Blockchain: Hand-on Ethereum Development"

description.text: <p>Blockchain&nbsp;is one of the newest trends in the technological world. By 2030,&nbsp;Blockchain&nbsp;would have added $3.1Tn business value in Banking, Finance, Healthcare, Supply Chain and other industries.&nbsp;Blockchain&nbsp;is fast getting adopted across organizations of all sizes, however, there is an acute shortage of&nbsp;Blockchain&nbsp;developers and professionals who can conceptualize and build applications for these organizations.&nbsp;Blockchain&nbsp;Bootcamp aims to introduce the&nbsp;Blockchain&nbsp;technology to the participants and hands-on workshop on&nbsp;Ethereum<span style="color: #000000;">. After attending this workshop,&nbsp;</span>participants<span style="color: #000000;">&nbsp;will have a better understanding of approach for building decentralized applications.&nbsp;</span><strong><span style="color: #990000;">It is a certification program&nbsp; from&nbsp;</span></strong><strong><span style="color: #990000;">DCentrum</span></strong></p>

report.title: A Webinar on Inspired Soft Computing: Application to Prediction of Environmental Hazards
report.keywords: Soft Computing, Environment Hazards, CIS Hyderabad, IEEE Hyderabad Section, IEEE Computational Intelligence Society

topic.title: Inspired Soft Computing: Application to Prediction of Environmental Hazards

report.title: Webinar on "Inspired Soft Computing: Application to Prediction of Environmental Hazards"

description.text: <div><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Soft computing, encompassing several intelligence tools and techniques in the form of neural networks, fuzzy logic, and evolutionary computation, is efficient in handling uncertainties and imprecision prevalent in real-world settings. One of the more recent applications of soft computing falls within the realm of environmental science as a way to model and predict hazards to the environment in an age of increasing pollution.</span></div> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">This webinar explores the use of a hybrid soft-computing paradigm for the prediction of the adsorption capacity of an environmentally-friendly and low-cost adsorbent. Presenting a viable alternative to conventional time-consuming batch study experiments within environmental analysis, this would come beneficial in predicting imminent environmental hazards so as to build up a sustainable environment.&nbsp;</span></p>

report.keywords: Soft computing, CIS Hyderabad, Environmental Hazards

topic.title: Inspired Soft Computing: Application to Prediction of Environmental Hazards
